topic.title: HPE Helion 2.0 Development Platform: Providing Remote Desktop Access to Windows DEA and Windows SQL Server Instances

body.p: This tutorial demonstrates how to set up Remote Desktop access to new Windows instances running in HPE Helion OpenStack Since the instances are running full versions of Windows, you must connect to them using Remote Desktop rather than SSH.
The steps needed to do this are as follows:

li.xref: Add the RDP security group to the instance
Connect to the instance with Remote Desktop Connection

ol.li: In the Horizon console, select Project, Access & Security.
Select Security Groups if it is not already selected.
Give the security group an appropriate name (such as cluster1-rdp), and an appropriate description (sucn as Remote Desktop Access).

section.title: Add the RDP security group to the instance

ol.li: Select Project, Instances. In the Actions column for your instance, select Edit Security Groups from the pull-down.
Click the + button next to the RDP security group you created to add it to the instance. Click Save.

section.title: Connect to the instance with Remote Desktop Connection

body.p: To connect to the instance, open Remote Desktop Connection, and enter the external IP address for the instance. Enter the user name in the form <InstanceName>/Administrator, and password. To retrieve the Administrator password, see Retrieving the Windows Password
